info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 9:07AM CDT until June 21 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Arkansas River At Toad Suck Lock And Dam Tailwater affecting Faulkner and Perry Counties.
Arkansas River At Morrilton affecting Conway and Perry Counties.
For the Arkansas River...including Dardanelle 1 NE, Morrilton, Toad Suck Lock And Dam Tailwater, Little Rock, Pine Bluff, Pendleton... elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Arkansas River at Toad Suck Lock And Dam Tailwater.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 275.0 feet, Mobile homes in the Toad Suck Community on the right descending bank near the State Highway 60 Bridge are threatened.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 269.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 273.6 feet Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 273.0 feet. - Flood stage is 275.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 915 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON
